Learners compare and contrasts cultural nuances of meaning in written and spoken language as expressed by speakers of the target
language in formal and informal setting.

D18DB7BACD3943B2A78531A3E5497348.description: Learners analyze the main plot, subplot, characters, their descriptions, roles, and significance in authentic literary texts.

EE1DB628FE0749FDB69DBEE119D5D38F.description:
Learners summarize the principal elements of nonfiction articles in newspapers, magazines, and websites on topics of current and
historical importance to members of the culture.

75C47A737F624DCD9BB3CDC3B977AC7A.description:
Learners discuss the main ideas and significant details of live and recorded discussions, lectures, and presentations on current or past
events from the target culture or that are being studied in another class.

95FC892B91B641E1BBEABEB96413C7FE.description:
understand discussions and presentations on many concrete and
abstract topics.

BF3503D5821347B3A0F52F65EA1A3DC1.description: often understand various viewpoints in extended arguments.

0F4313835F7E433DA817EBF397812855.description: easily understand detailed reports and exposés.

E9AC27A1BC7348E18C90634DCD39B761.description:
Advanced High Learners can easily follow narrative,
informational, and descriptive speech. They can understand
discussions on most topics that deal with special interests,
unfamiliar situations, and abstract concepts. They can
sometimes follow extended arguments and different points of
view.

326FEB7EB65246C18109C1AA03D2A456.description: understand directions and instructions on everyday tasks.

6EE1A5E9093E421398BF98C3282ED1B8.description:
understand the main idea and many details of descriptions or
interviews.

BB55D81B8F2F42F49026E6A488F96D75.description:
Advanced Mid Learners can understand the main idea and
most supporting details on a variety of topics of personal and
general interest, as well as some topics of professional
interest. They can follow stories and descriptions of some
length and in various time frames. They can understand
information presented in most genres, even when not familiar
with the topic.

657D89E4FDB14B168DF237BB4CA3867D.description: understand the main idea of popular genres.

88C999643C654E85899B6D367048A5EC.description:
understand descriptions and stories of events that have happened or
will happen.

5CCE5ECCCF5C4E6FA6FDEC083FDCDAF3.description:
Advanced Low Learners can understand the main idea and
some supporting details in organized speech on a variety of
topics of personal and general interest. They can follow
stories and descriptions of some length and in various time
frames. They can understand information presented in a
variety of genres on familiar topics, even when something
unexpected is expressed.

E22DD3AA685A471B8A8846475CE98B5B.description:
Advanced Range: Understands main ideas and supporting details on familiar and some new concrete topics from a variety of more complex
texts that have a clear, organized structure.

A79ED4F00B74485290F140BA5A44C083.description:
Learners use knowledge acquired in other setting sand from other subject areas to comprehend spoken and written messages in the
target languages.

86FAD096F2964A7D8FF35033B8C21EE7.description: Learners identify the principal characters and discuss the main ideas and themes in selected literary texts.

8FD6A1F324EA447B8684CA708906D82F.description:
Learners describe the main themes and significant details on topics from other subjects and products of the cultures as found in
newspapers, magazines, websites, or other printed sources for target language audiences.

97B8EB3F8A704F1CAA3E33CFCDEDDA89.description:
Learners relate the main themes and significant details on topics from other subjects and products of the cultures as presented on TV,
radio, video, or live presentations.

2389C455D96543D3BF51F5C01509D481.description: sometimes understand situations with complicating factors.

FA26E76284A24DAF8CC91EC46227B1AD.description:
understand a few details in ads, announcements, and other simple
recordings.

1DF92DB797764136925CEFE4655472BC.description: easily understand straightforward information or interactions.

901B093CFE4A4388981B8595816010E8.description:
Intermediate High Learners can easily understand the
main idea in messages and presentations on a variety of
topics related to everyday life and personal interests and
studies. They can usually understand a few details of what
they overhear in conversations, even when something
unexpected is expressed. They can sometimes follow what
they hear about events and experiences in various time
frames.

41A4883E9F404F61A7613AABAC2F5E20.description: understand messages related to their everyday life.

10BD8492002A4E628E453F51C908F058.description: understand the main idea of what they listen to for personal enjoyment.

D2C69ADAF0D64F9B8C8C95F47D5E963C.description:
understand basic information in ads, announcements, and other simple
recordings.

D70ABDA59D22446982303B371FC635A0.description:
Intermediate Mid Learners can understand the main idea
messages and presentations on a variety of topics related
to everyday life and personal interests and studies. They
can understand the main idea in conversations that they
overhear.

3AD64022554346DD9ED9A674B43759DC.description:
understand questions and simple statements on everyday topics when
they are part of the conversation.

A29A863C1DE44466A373C3B89953AC3C.description: understand messages related to their basic needs.

F5ED5C5ACCBE46E187ABE969BBEAD444.description: understand the basic purpose of a message.

F48BD14AF5AE411AB9C7595BCDA73158.description:
Intermediate Low Learners can understand the main idea
in short, simple messages and presentations on familiar
topics. They can understand the main idea of simple
conversations that they overhear.

CABEFAD58AE74C02BC5A181599480E91.description: Intermediate Range: Understands main ideas and some supporting details on familiar topics from a variety of texts.

19DB3C968B184A8086BD5A52D9FA88E8.description: Learners interpret the meaning of gestures, intonation, and other visual or auditory cues.

D98F26A953784D199A9AD7253FEFFB5D.description: Learners identify the principal message contained in various media such as illustrated texts, posters, or advertisements.

CEAE7CD67EEA445D8E92AD383099612B.description: Learners identify the principal characters of stories or children’s literature and dramatize the main themes and ideas.

96B7EC2A1676449EB55ABE9837A510F1.description:
Learners report out the content of brief, written messages and short personal notes on familiar topics such as family, school events, and
celebrations.

DB573643431247FC9C7003DC7146D9B8.description: Learners identify people and objects in their environment or from other school subjects, based on oral and written descriptions.

2A75C68D61964D37A5F64820E0A1FA63.description:
Learners list key actions from developmentally appropriate narratives such as personal anecdotes, familiar fairy tales, and narratives
based on familiar themes.

477B93A431D74A64B6EE791EA428DBAA.description: sometimes understand the main topic of conversations that they overhear.

FCC0555E751A483B9854AF1CF0E27587.description: understand simple information when presented with pictures and graphs.

FD8657C44F3E4B0F9273941424443994.description: sometimes understand simple questions or statements on familiar topics.

EC835587B47A46AD9058483217E7C0E5.description:
Novice High Learners can often understand words,
phrases, and simple sentences related to everyday
life. They can recognize pieces of information and
sometimes understand the main topic of what is being
said.

B109DB5A2D2D469E96F218B61482C96E.description:
recognize and sometimes understand words and phrases that they have
learned for specific purposes.

9ECB7BFD1BD14124BC8BB820A205E0A8.description:
recognize and sometimes understand basic information in words and
phrases that they have memorized.

181DD62934A04560A5650C1DEB0F3DD9.description:
Novice Mid Learners can recognize some familiar
words and phrases when they hear them spoken.

6C7B34E518534DE4A27A642476F3DF28.description:
occasionally understand isolated words that they have memorized,
particularly when accompanied by gestures or pictures.

71AB7424502444EC84B67EBF0438E74B.description: occasionally identify the sound of a character or a word.

F27F71BEE5DC44DCBED6672C361E4F43.description:
Novice Low Learners can recognize a few memorized
words and phrases when they hear them spoken.

90912E1E5571412ABD7E696A07D80E8C.description:
Novice Range: Understands words, phrases, and formulaic language that have been practiced and memorized to get meaning of the
main idea from simple, highly predictable oral or written texts with strong visual support.

7C25A7EA05874B3F9A3ECACA3C7B6BFE.description:
Standard 1.2 Interpretive Communication
Learners understand, interpret, and analyze what is heard, read, or viewed in the target language on a variety of topics.

1E8CCB2540C7424E96C996021B6487AA.description:
participate with ease in complex discussions with multiple
participants on a wide variety of topics.

C5344872A06C4FEEA1CD1415EC7F2E47.description: discuss complex information in debates or meetings

0E15B0FB110A4196B2C70668111B3DE9.description:
Superior Learners can communicate with ease, accuracy, and
fluency. They can participate fully and effectively in discussions
on a variety of topics in formal and informal settings. They can
discuss at length complex issues by structuring arguments and
developing hypotheses.

22884DBFD6E44EBBB7B2955C2C0D963A.description:
Learners exchange, support, and discuss their opinions and individual perspectives with peers and/or speakers of the target language
on a variety of topics dealing with contemporary and historical issues.

46A22BC0F5A9445A83A5281C7B2AC1B8.description: Learners share their analyses and personal reactions to expository and literary texts with peers and/or speakers of the target language.

1E502E85BF8F40C3BF832EBA601467AA.description:
Learners develop and propose solutions to issues and problems that are of concern to members of their own and the target cultures
through group work.

6E3FA95376A44CF5BE3CC7D2AFB06990.description:
Learners discuss, orally or in writing, current or past events that are of significance in the target culture or that are being studied in
another subject.

6210B70CAE67492E91C3984A11C786D7.description: support their opinion and construct hypotheses.

16C7E1DC09984931B234C956E26977FC.description:
exchange detailed information on topics within and beyond their
fields of interest.

10B27D3EA1484ECFA86EA737CD61AF8F.description:
exchange complex information about academic and professional
tasks.

7E2F6C7B95CD4DD0830805E3BCD4C5AB.description:
Advanced High Learners can express themselves freely and
spontaneously, and for the most part accurately, on concrete topics and on most complex issues. They can usually support
their opinion and develop hypotheses on topics of particular
interest or personal experience.

61B6E505BD9C479E8A2B08ED6DF14052.description: handle an complication or unexpected turn of events.

153243E7739C421F8D95FC57FA452764.description:
exchange general information on topics outside their fields of
interest.

CB2F97B9A0764A409538CD9CDD7D8CD3.description:
communicate effectively on a wide variety of present, past, and
future events.

0FD39981DB3D421A9B33507E98CCDB9F.description:
Advanced Mid Learners can express themselves fully not only
on familiar topics but also on some concrete social, academic,
and professional topics. They can talk in detail and in an
organized way about events and experiences in various time
frames. They can confidently handle routine situations with an
unexpected complication. They can share their points of view in
discussions on some complex issues.

A0D1CC8950A34CE68F5DF5E8AD0BF79C.description:
resolve an unexpected complication has arises in a familiar
situation.

1020FB71C2A14763A416874FD35F279F.description: compare and contrast life in different locations and in different times

EBD4FC04DD4E4166994C5C927E1A8C85.description:
participate in conversations on a wide variety of topics that go
beyond their everyday lives.

718BC8B031914AEA8608C52586BC190E.description:
Advanced Low Learners can participate in conversations
about familiar topics that go beyond their everyday lives. They
can talk in an organized way and with some detail about events
and experiences in various time frames. They can describe
people, places, and things in an organized way and with some
detail. They can handle a familiar situation with an unexpected
complication.

B1610007F6414BB887C008B06AE8A8B9.description:
Advanced Range: Expresses self fully to maintain conversations on familiar topics and new concrete social, academic, and work-related
topics. Can communicate in paragraph-length conversation about events with detail and organization. Confidently
handles situations with an unexpected complication. Shares point of view in discussions.

658DE0D3D6FA4164BB125AF89B60B11D.description: Learners develop and propose solutions to uses and problems related to the school or community through group work.

7F78118E81E64045861C3EB5C398F1C7.description: Learners acquire goods, services, or information orally and /or in writing.

72E8F851E8684E16891FB1D31F009F1B.description:
Learners compare, contrast, and express opinions and preferences about the information gathered regarding events, experiences, and
other school subjects.

122C38C651F946A99EAFCA62F577195D.description:
Learners exchange information about personal events, memorable experiences, and other school subjects with peers and/or members
of their target cultures.

CA3C01D7440C4C84917C645EEE8BF529.description:
Learners follow and give directions for participating in age-appropriate cultural activities and investigating the function of products of the
foreign culture. They ask and respond to questions for clarification.

C1571138DDB2400CBBEE50624FBCA650.description:
use their language to handle a situation that may have a
complication.

3014FD168CD84F0C956DFBD9C8BF86A2.description: use their language to do a task that requires multiple steps.

844A734E5BD043A18D1B1E47C1F2C626.description: exchange information related to areas of mutual interest.

B0ACD03C083F425BA6EEE8B120AD8A81.description:
Intermediate High Learners can participate with ease and
confidence in conversations on familiar topics. They can
usually talk about events and experiences in various time
frames. They can usually describe people, places, and
things. They can handle social interactions in everyday situations, sometimes even when there is an unexpected
complication.

A3540BAB2D5D44DD9434201DD1806D4B.description: exchange information about subjects of special interest to them.

89319E9C268C4BE9B8167029FCE45749.description: use their language to handle tasks related to their personal needs.

BDCACD94BF0448339029A99C151F2732.description: talk about their daily activities and personal preferences.

D169D4B6965B4436AEA8986271063425.description:
start, maintain, and end a conversation on a variety of familiar
topics.

7ECD503A7CB544999ADC047D227923CF.description:
Intermediate Mid Learners can participate in conversations on
familiar topics using sentences and series of sentences. They
can handle short social interactions in everyday situations by
asking and answering a variety of questions. They can usually
say what they want to say about self and their everyday lives.

0AAA7631757944CBAAF161B56D8E7C8D.description: use the language to meet their basic needs in familiar situations.

944D98688A764076A93462DEBB596F1E.description:
ask and answer questions on factual information that is familiar to
them.

46EF5254B4BC4E3284273DA550C4FB4C.description: have a simple conversation on a number of everyday topics.

78BE65E2804F43A69AEEF829E5F0F8CC.description:
Intermediate Low Learners can participate in conversations on
a number of familiar topics using simple sentences. They can
handle short social interactions in everyday situations by asking
and answering simple questions.

3D092420880D48DE9809617068A4332F.description:
Intermediate Range: Expresses self and participates in conversations on familiar topics using sentences and series of sentences. Handles
short social interactions in everyday situations by asking and answering a variety of questions. Can communicate about
self, others, and everyday life.

19FE492821D34976A8A5E63FF499D076.description:
Learners exchange greetings, leave takings, and common classroom interactions using culturally appropriate gestures and oral
expressions.

8C8DEA97213E4CA68065785E7E5B795C.description:
Learners exchange descriptions of people and tangible products of the culture such as toys, clothing, types of dwellings, foods, with
classmates.

48E4BBF111EB4F3BA3DA0005C7876B4B.description: Learners share likes and dislikes with one another.

2218C30FD46D4493817D154E65BA0864.description:
Learners ask and answer questions about topics such as family, school events, and celebrations in person or via letters, email, voice
chats, video-chat, or instant messages.

27E8C272EFF94A9FA377A5378CF9B253.description: Learners give and follow simple instructions in order to participate in age-appropriate classroom and/or cultural activities.

74FE8807EED94C66925D33BEEC63B0F0.description: interact with others in everyday situations.

8FF9AA92B3A3482AAA3BF843E0C16689.description: ask for and give simple directions.

AE5FC6B3C87D49179F324E250FDA6D34.description: exchange information using texts, graphs, or pictures.

42E60C25FED94117BE1FDC4FE69D04EB.description:
Novice High Learners can communicate and exchange
information about familiar topics using phrases and simple
sentences, sometimes supported by memorized language. They can usually handle short social interactions in
everyday situations by asking and answering simple questions.

6753CB1DEA89440EAD7AE387AC7F4220.description: communicate some basic information about their everyday lives.

C76484F7F24841B4A8C0F89BCB0312E9.description: communicate basic information about self and people they know.

A9CDE650F4A7460592995D0F0C60AA35.description: make some simple statements in a conversation.

FE1E50B51C1D464F8E4B5F38A6017116.description: answer a variety of simple questions.

04969DC1492F4CEC93FEA8175D0B1B5C.description: greet and leave people in a polite way.

6D65BA275D7D46ED87740626242C2FAE.description:
Novice Mid Learners can communicate on very familiar topics
using a variety of words and phrases that they have practiced
and memorized.

3BF17AA103854FB5B1D72D66AEA82BB2.description:
Novice Low Learners can communicate on some very familiar
topics using single words and phrases that they have practiced
and memorized.

472AB09E6DC641E9A1027FBC68979286.description:
Novice Range: Expresses self in conversations on very familiar topics using a variety of words, phrases, simple sentences, and
questions that have been highly practiced and memorized.

8EA45BFFCA0748748124B94919744DC7.description:
Standard 1.1 Interpersonal: Learners interact and negotiate meaning in spoken, signed, or written
conversations to share information, reactions, feelings, and opinions.
